comment: Not much on the nose. Molasses, oak, tobacco, with a little fruit on the finish.
Even uniform, Canadian style whiskey. A bit like an upscale crown royalle.
Unexceptional nose, mild flavor of hazelnuts with slightly spicy finish. Stronger alcohol throughout.
Tastes like a Christmas cookie almost no alcohol burn
Tamed bitter (not alcohol bitter),  balanced spice, vanilla and floral would make a great mixer with coke
Black licorice flavor, not a fan
Spicy on its own, but excellent in an old fashioned
Nothing special on its own but very good as a mixer.
Has a mellow taste and no burn
Not much of a burn, very sweet with an almost marshmallow candy flavor to it
The best Canada has to offer
That brandy barrel finish really ties this one together. Its still a Canadian whisky, so there’s that. But this is definitely darker, richer than the standard stuff.
Very smooth.  Not bad but could have more flavor.

Following my review for the standard Pendleton comes this review for Pendleton Midnight Canadian Whisky.  It's mostly the same juice except a portion of the whisky was aged in brandy barrels.  Let's see if it fairs any better.

Nose: Like its predecessor, still too much of the sweet solvents, though not to the degree you might expect since the ABV is bumped up to 45% here.  It's more fruity.  Starfruit (never gotten that note in a whisk(e)y before) and musty bubblegum.  Still too much alcohol burn.  

Palate: Light-bodied, with a slightly more classy variety of cloying, artificial sweetness.  Non-descript fruitiness, vanilla, and spice.  

Finish:  Short but once again, that familiar, unpleasant aftertaste lingers for too long.  Bitter, vanilla-grape cough syrup with some green pepper.  

Verdict:  This is another "no" from me.  While slightly more tolerable than the standard issue, this is still not good and the aftertaste is really off-putting to me.  

1.75 ~ Poor
Maple Nose, small and short blast finish that keeps you warm for a bit.  Yum

Alcohol is too dominant on the nose, I can't get a bead on what else there is. There's pepper throughout but it's not dominating. Hint of light maple syrup. Not a bad drink but nothing special or memorable.
A little sweet and unique for me.
Not a sipper. Tastes like a cheap tequila is mixed in.
